intro: Peucedanum hispanicum, commonly known as Spanish cow parsley, is a herbaceous plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, white or greenish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in temperate climates. Its seeds are often used in traditional herbal medicine for their purported digestive and anti-inflammatory properties. The plant's structure and growth habits make it well adapted to its natural habitat in the Mediterranean region.
